definitions.definition: devote (time, effort, or oneself) to a particular task or purpose.
examples: Joan has dedicated her life to animals
synonyms: consign "she dedicated her life to the sick"

definitions.definition: devote (something) to a particular subject or purpose.
examples: you should dedicate a telephone line to each modem you plan to install

definitions.definition: cite (a book or other artistic work) as being issued or performed in someone's honor.
examples: the novel is dedicated to the memory of my mother
synonyms: address; assign "a book dedicated to his muse"

definitions.definition: formally open or unveil (a building or memorial).
examples: the ex-president came to dedicate a $2.6 million recreation center

definitions.definition: ceremonially assign (a church or other building) to a deity or saint.
examples: the parish church is dedicated to St. Paul
synonyms: sanctify; formalhallow "the chapel was dedicated to the Virgin Mary"
